articles.title: S&P 500 Hits a Rare Christmas Eve Record
articles.mainIdea: S&P 500 Hits a Rare Christmas Eve Record
articles.summary: Barrons.com: S&P 500 Hits a Rare Christmas Eve Record. The S&P 500 rallied to an all-time high on Wednesday, its first Christmas Eve record since 2013. It was a quiet, though productive day. The S&P 500 rose 0.3%. The Dow gained 288 points, or 0.6%, and closed at a new record, too. Related tickers mentioned: ^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC.

articles.summary: Barrons.com: It’s a Wonderful Market—if You Know How to Play It. The Cboe Volatility Index’s long-term average is around 19, so the present level of 14 suggests peace in markets and goodwill toward investors. At least for a month. Related tickers mentioned: ^GSPC.

articles.title: The 120 Most Powerful Hollywood Studios and Executives, Ranked
articles.mainIdea: The 120 Most Powerful Hollywood Studios and Executives, Ranked
articles.summary: Variety: The 120 Most Powerful Hollywood Studios and Executives, Ranked. In business, the power of individual leaders is an inherently hard thing to measure. It’s subjective, and it fluctuates on any given day, just like the strength of an electrical current goes up and down depending on environmental conditions. articles.title: Technical strategist explains how S&P 500 could hit 7,300 in early 2026
articles.mainIdea: Technical strategist explains how S&P 500 could hit 7,300 in early 2026
articles.summary: Investing.com: Technical strategist explains how S&P 500 could hit 7,300 in early 2026. Investing.com -- The S&P 500 may be setting up for a breakout that carries the index toward 7,300 early next year, according to Wolfe Research technical strategists, who say recent market action is aligning with a bullish roadmap. Related tickers mentioned: ^GSPC.
